pros: What Caron does for patients is amazing, and being a part of that feels good.  The physical work environment is beautiful and you get a great discount at the cafeteria which has great food.  They also have a mentor program where you get paired with a person who has been there for at least a couple of years to help you acclimate.  I liked that this was a person outside of my department.
cons: Supervisor micromanaged EVERYTHING.  I basically may as well have asked when I had to use the restroom.  No ownership of projects.  The pay is awful, because it's a non-profit, which is understandable, but when you're charging patients $38,000 for 30 days of treatment and patients can go to FOR PROFIT treatment centers that have better amenities and get the same treatment for LESS, why would you pay $38K?  A lot of confusion as to why it was so expensive to get treatment there, and no explanation other than "we're the best" for the high price.

review_title: Not bad if you know the "right" people and constantly kiss butt.
pros: Many of the employees love they're jobs at Caron and support one another extremely well. The campus itself is very nice, excellent food and amenitites for patients and staff. Pay is quite good, better than any other local drug rehab.
cons: I worked on the adolescent side of the campus, the amount of pressure and paranoia placed on counselor assistants was ridiculous. They don't have a thorough written manual, there are constant emails about what new protocols are in place, then they're retracted days, weeks or months later. Often, one singular incident would result in unit-wide protocol change. Yearly reviews seemed to dig for one or two negative aspects throughout a year; not nearly enough praise for working double shifts, managing extremely difficult patients or entire communities or taking extra time to creatively implement ideas or tools that work in one situation. Also, as this is a private pay facility, too often clinical decisions where swayed by what management needed financially. Too often clinical judgement was thrown out the door and people not qualified to have as much say as they're given, called too many shots.

review_title: Integrity of Mission / Vagueness of Direction
pros: Solid pay, above average benefits (health care, 401k with match, good vacation), friendly environment where majority of people genuinely respect and appreciate the company's position and vision to positively impact the lives of recovering addicts, opportunities for advancement, environment is very supportive of informed input and in general there is a sincere desire to improve.  Contrary to other reviewers, my experience has been that the company seeks to remain solvent but does not wish to extract additional profit simply for profit's sake, a stance I find to be refreshing in modern commerce where profit is almost always king.
cons: Lack of coordination across departments in regard to projects and efforts (results in separate groups of people working in separate directions and wasting effort to arrive at unsuccessful outcomes), command from above in terms of desires but not always in terms of direction or pathway to achieving those desires, lack of discipline for those who make decisions in silos and diverge from the overall strategy.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Rated #1 best place to work in South Florida in 2019! Clinically driven, industry best benefits, family work culture. There isn’t a better model for treating substance use disorders in the industry. Anyone who understands that addiction is a family disease would love to work here. 70% of all of the clients who come to the Florida programs will have their family come and live with them on site for a minimum of a week. All services are bundled into a single monthly cost give me a great deal of transparency for clients and allowing care to be determined based on what a person needs and not based on finances or reimbursement.
cons: Industry as a whole has a negative reputation, though Caron has done a lot to differentiate. Definitely not a 9-to-5 job since people in an inpatient setting have issues around the clock, however, all the people who work here enthusiastically jump in to help people whenever they need it. Tons of support and supervision to get the job done.

pros: The company offers a great work environment, lots of wonderful benefits (health insurance, lots of PTO, tuition reimbursement, bonus plans!), and lots of training and educational opportunities for employees! I saw lots of comments in reviews regarding leadership, but the team in place is doing a great job of keeping Caron as a leader in Addiction treatment. I am proud to work at the organization!

pros:
Great benefits, opportunities for advancement, work is fulfilling

While I worked there, I had full health insurance with vision and dental, and the plans were good enough to cover my weird allergies. The company promotes internally, so even starting part time can get you to full time, spiritual care, counseling or supervisor. If you care about making a difference in people's lives, but still try to be realistic about your impact, this place could work for you.
cons: I wish I was the only one to say this, but this is a company that is either for or against you. If you fit in and do what you're told, you can go far. But if you don't...you won't make it 6 months. Many many people who work here are recovering addicts, so being one yourself will give you a big leg up in the hiring process. The workplace is very tight and even a little cliquey. It's a place where your friends matter more than your job title. I entered as the company was restructuring my division, and it was clear that training me was not a priority. I was put in the middle of two warring factions with different ideas on how to run the unit. My attempts to ask for help were muffled, and I was severely punished for my inevitable mistakes. I have been accused of lying and was even put on administrative leave for a while until HR cleared me. I was told openly that I did not fit in for being young, educated, and not a drug addict in recovery, and many people were happy to see me go when I quit just after 6 months.

review_title: Not all its cracked up to be! Get out while you can. This place is an undercover joke!!!!!
pros: Watching the patients come into treatment at their worst and leaving at their best. Great bonds made along the way with some of the "REAL" employees.
cons: There is not enough room in this little box to give a variety of cons that have accumulated over 10+ years. Let's say this rehab is ALL about the money. Wait, maybe a small bit about the families as well, because...they have the money. This place is overall not about patient care unless the NBA, NFL, Oprah etc are paying for treatment. They give free treatment to those with millions and there for a reason other to be sober and the line down the mountain seeking true sobriety is asked to pay some $38000. Scholarships that are raised by "staff" (you get harassed if you chose not to contribute ) are given to those who are undeserving and have money. They give Berks County beds (discounted) to patients from other states. Whatever makes them look good on the outside. Please note, it was not always like this, but the "higher ups" need to do what they need to do to pay there bills. Most staff are either backside kissers, or bullies. There are some great staff that come in hoping to make a change for themselves and others but realize quickly what they are in for and run for the hills. Staff is never the same. Whoa there is sooooo much more to mention but I am sure you get the point. Those looking for employment, continue looking. Those looking for treatment, keep searching. Caron labels themselves the "best". They once we're! Now, many would disagree.
